channel.title: Comments on: Reasons to use Bicep over Terraform
channel.description: A blog about things I learn at the keyboard: DevOps, CI/CD, Cloud, Automation, to name a few....

item.title: By: Carl
item.dc:creator: Carl
item.description:
Some reasons we prefer Terraform: - multiple provider support such as GitHub / Azure DevOps / Azure Active Directory - lifecycle model. Any resource removed from the configuration will be destroyed automatically.
I would say Hashicorp and Microsoft should work together to get both technologies converged and provide the user preferences as options to choose from. It is a really compelling idea that Terraform could pull the current state from Azure in a performant way. Hopefully the Azure Deployment Stacks initiative will lead to something.
item.content:encoded:
Some reasons we prefer Terraform:
– multiple provider support such as GitHub / Azure DevOps / Azure Active Directory
– lifecycle model. Any resource removed from the configuration will be destroyed automatically.

I would say Hashicorp and Microsoft should work together to get both technologies converged and provide the user preferences as options to choose from. It is a really compelling idea that Terraform could pull the current state from Azure in a performant way. Hopefully the Azure Deployment Stacks initiative will lead to something.

item.title: By: Jens Kruse
item.dc:creator: Jens Kruse
item.description: Nice comparison. After nearly two years working with Terraform in Azure environments, I would not choose it again (though it is a really nice tool). But Bicep with its day 0 support for Azure would be meanwhile my tool of choice.
